briefdescription.para: Byte offset within blk?????.dat where this block's data is stored.
Byte offset within rev?????.dat where this block's undo data is stored.
(memory only) Total amount of work (expected number of hashes) in the chain up to and including this block
(memory only) Sequential id assigned to distinguish order in which blocks are received.
Verification status of this block. See enum BlockStatus.

detaileddescription.para: Number of transactions in this block. Note: in a potential headers-first mode, this number cannot be relied upon

memberdef.argsstring: (unsigned int nFileIn, unsigned int nBlockPosIn, CBlock &block)
memberdef.name: CBlockIndex

detaileddescription.para: The block chain is a tree shaped structure starting with the genesis block at the root, with each block potentially having multiple candidates to be the next block. pprev and pnext link a path through the main/longest chain. A blockindex may have multiple pprev pointing back to it, but pnext will only point forward to the longest branch, or will be null if the block is not part of the longest chain.
